attributes.action: Change the overtime law so everyone gets paid all the hours they work
attributes.background: Too many companies can get away with making their employees work over their contracted hours and not pay them for all the hours they work, this is not fair for the people as everyone should be paid for all hours they work, including all overtime hours they do.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/overtime-your-rights

This is the section of law which needs changed to make it fair for all employees regardless of job title, as it states the employers do not need to pay their employees overtime as long as the total hours worked does not drop their pay to below the national living wage, how can this be seen as a fair and just system.

attributes.action: Abolish Ban on Entertainment Shows using House of Commons Footage.
attributes.background:
'no extracts of Parliamentary proceedings may be used in any light entertainment programme or in a programme of political satire'
 
This is a rule of coverage for Parliamentary footage that has existed since 1989. It is an infringement on both freedom of speech and press.
attributes.additional_details:
https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200203/cmselect/cmbroad/786/786.pdf -Page 22
 
With the globalisation of media through the internet and social media, it is now foolish to assume that the electorate will be 'protected' from seeing satirical footage of Parliament.
 
Without a constitution, we MUST uphold individual freedoms in statute law. This can only be done by ridding of this futile and ineffective regulation.

attributes.action: Homeoffice should not over charge health surcharge from UK Visa Applicants
attributes.background: UK Suppose Visa is issued for 33 Months however applicants are being charged for three Full years.
attributes.additional_details:
As per GOV.UK health surcharge for Visa Applicants is £200 per year at the moment as it going to be increased.
Why there is full 1 health surcharge where Visa is being issued for less than a year.
For example suppose Visa is issued for 33 months but Applicants have to pay health surcharge full £600 which is for 3 full years.

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of early cancer symptoms among GPs
attributes.background: After recent family dealings with cancer and previous friends I have known dying from cancer it was evident that the GP's involved were at a loss to diagnose what was happening which may have contributed to the disease not being treated early enough resulting in prolonged suffering.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide more training on the symptoms and tests that can spot cancer early.

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.

attributes.action: H M Forces Veterans ID Card
attributes.background: Following many years loyal service in H M Forces, indeed having been willing to give their life for their country, I think it is time H M Government recognised this service for all veterans by establishing an official MoD H M Forces Form 90V ID card for all those who have served.
attributes.additional_details: The ID card should show the service (RAF, Army etc.), the rank on retiring, dates of service, photo, signature and date of birth, to therefore make it a fully recognised VIC (Veterans Identity Card). The card should also include a PIN facility for electronic use.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Put ISIS returnees on a Temporary Exclusion order to prevent their return to UK
attributes.background: Let’s make an example of returning supporters of ISIS from returning to the UK for 2 years. We need to send a message loud and clear that the British public should be able to feel safe in our own country.
attributes.additional_details: It is quite disturbing how little remorse has been shown in recent cases and I feel that they need to be de-radicalised BEFORE they enter the UK. The exclusion order should give them time to understand the gravity of their actions.

attributes.action: Require Personality Disorders training for all workers in mental health services
attributes.background: Through personal experience, as well as others, it has come to my attention that those with Personality Disorders are often being unfairly treated by mental health services due to preconceived misconceptions. We need to listen more to sufferers themselves in order to put the best treatment in place

attributes.action: Stop deportation of Zimbabweans
attributes.background: Zimbabwe is being ruled by a political party that has been repeatedly accused of breaking election laws. Zimbabwe doesn’t respect human rights & is one of poorest countries with a high unemployment record & yet has the most expensive fuel in the World.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government knows this and yet is currently detaining and deporting people back to Zimbabwe

attributes.action: Repeal Breed-Specific Legislation.
attributes.background: 1,000s of wrongly accused dogs are being destroyed each year because of an Act that judges dogs on appearance and not temperament.
attributes.additional_details: Adding Staffordshire Bull Terriers to the Dangerous Dogs Act was debated and dismissed. The UK government has no intentions on adding them to the list.

attributes.action: Ban the distribution of plastic coated advertising leaflets
attributes.background: Over the past 4 months, I have been collecting all advertising leaflets that find their way into my mailbox. Over 55 leaflets from big  and small companies, and only 3 of them I was able to recycle. The rest were all printed on paper, coated with plastic, making them non-recyclable.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic coating on advertising leaflets is the norm, which contributes to the depletion of global resources, the deterioration of our planet, and the destruction of animal habitat's and their lives. 
These leaflets are non-recyclable, meaning they end up being thrown "away". Both production and disposal of these marketing instruments are contributing to global warming, and ultimately the destruction of our planet. 
Companies should be prompted to switch to recycled paper, or FSC paper.

attributes.action: Reduce normal rate-VAT to 8% on takeaway food
attributes.background: The normal rate VAT 20% on takeaway food. It is very high, Most shops are not able to pay the liability and they start cheating the system. Almost all individual owned takeaway shops are hiding their turnover.
attributes.additional_details: In Switzerland the rate 7.7% and in Germany 7% for takeaway foods.

attributes.action: Do not write off unpaid Child Support Agency child maintenance payments
attributes.background: Non-resident parents who have for years refused to pay child maintenance arranged through the Child Support Agency should be made to pay what is owed. Arrears should not be written off.
attributes.additional_details: I want every single person out there who thinks writing off arrears is wrong to sign my petition, why should they get away with not paying for their children.

attributes.action: Abolish the private education system by nationalising private schools.
attributes.background:
Private schools have always been a tool for the wealthy to ensure they have the best opportunities in life. 

For a society in which equal opportunity is one of the core principles, it is a disgrace to allow an inherent advantage to some children based on the size of their parents’ wealth.
attributes.additional_details:
Students from private schools were 8% more likely than the average student to attend an Oxbridge university in 2016. Apart from a better chance at higher grades, this is part of the high quality reputation schools like Eton gain, which makes them much more likely to get in.

It is this unfairness that means we are calling on the Government to take private schools under public control, give them the same funding as other state schools, and ensure there is greater equality of opportunity for all.

attributes.action: Review the provision of hospital meals.
attributes.background: Every hospital has a responsibility to provide the highest level of care possible for their patients and this  includes the quality and nutritional value of the food served
attributes.additional_details: Whilst meals are provided three times per day, they are not always edible and are often left on a heated trolley which changes the taste & texture of foods, often making the meals inedible, particularly to the more vulnerable

attributes.action: Place a Fair charge £20.00 Cap on Council PCN charges
attributes.background: Please the Government needs to place a fair charge on PCN. The whole process of appealing is too time wasting for any small business and very hard to understand, to then expect a day in Council Court is totally out of the question to the average working Person or vulnerable persons.
attributes.additional_details: Constant changing of sign posts, machines, payment options limited by poor facilities and many of our traffic wardens have no interest in communicating with confused drivers. The ruthless way in which some wardens place tickets has to be bought down to an affordable level.

attributes.action: Review laws making baby-changing facilities more accessible to fathers.
attributes.background: TheDadsnet hear daily from dad's who haven’t had access to safe places to change their baby’s nappy. Including an NHS hospital. We want the government to change the laws around the provision of baby changing facilities accessible to fathers, like former President Obama did in  the USA.
attributes.additional_details: "When we arrived at the hospital my son needed a nappy change. I checked the men's and disabled toilets for changing facilities to find none. I asked at the information desk where baby changing was and was told it was only in the ladies. I asked where dads were expected to change their babies and was told to ask a nurse to use a side room but not to bank on them allowing it. I ended up changing my son's nappy on the floor in a corridor." Dadsnet Member.

attributes.action: Review the act of rehoming lost dogs from 7 days to 28 days
attributes.background: 7 days does not give the owner time to come forward. Especially as there are certain legal procedures to follow. There is not enough information of what steps to take. The awaiting reports from vets and Dog wardens does not make the 7 day ruling realistic.
attributes.additional_details: When a family pet goes missing what steps do you take at this distressing time.? There should be a simple guideline, but also a time limit that reflects all the necessary searches and avenue's the distraught owner has to endure with  this very stressful ordeal. A plan of action put into place with a cap on fees. This would stop the monies being the incentive for unscrupulous organisations.

attributes.action: Clarity on the conditions in which Sec. of State for NI would call a border poll
attributes.background: In absence of clarity in the Good Friday Belfast agreement, I wish to request the Secretary of state for NI clarify the conditions that must be met to call a border poll on Irish reunification.

attributes.action: Make School Meals More Affordable
attributes.background: I am concerned that some schools are charging exorbitant prices for School Meals which could easily prove costly for parents, long term. As a solution, I would like to see the Education Act amended to cap School Meal prices at a level affordable to low and middle-income earners.

attributes.action: Grant full time students access to a Maternity Allowance
attributes.background: Many full time students who fall pregnant or give birth during their studies, are unable to access statutory maternity pay or allowance. These are one of the few groups of women who are missing out on their maternity rights. Let’s give full time students access to maternity allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of access occurs when a student hasn’t worked in the qualifying period - you can see how that works here (see maternity allowance and statutory maternity pay): 
https://www.staffsunion.com/advice/money/financeguides/parents/

We suggest full time students should automatically have access to maternity allowance or that a special allowance be drawn up to accommodate these cases that provides equivalent support.

attributes.action: Lower the age at which men can claim the state pension.
attributes.background: In an age of total equality, surely it is only fair and right that men and women enjoy a similar amount of time in retirement. As life expectancy for men is, on average, 4 years shorter than for women, surely they (men) should be able to claim their state pension 4 years earlier.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Create a UK group to design, construct and operate UK nuclear power stations
attributes.background: 51% of all electricity generated in UK is by Gas and Coal powered stations. 21% is generated by old Nuclear plants. We need to replace these with new nuclear power stations. I believe that the UK should design, develop, construct and operate these with UK skills by creating a UK Nuclear Power Group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government should create a UK Nuclear Power Group to manage, design, develop, construct and operate the new Nuclear power stations required for our UK national electricity grid. 
A UK group would not only create thousands of jobs in the UK, using the skills that are developed in the UK and ensure the security of the electric network remained in our control.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Human trafficking Sex slavery: anyone found guilty receives a life sentence
attributes.background: Sex slavery one of the many forms of slavery, under the banner Human Trafficking. An estimated 4.8 million (mainly) women and children are sex slaves worldwide. They are stolen, locked up, beaten, can't leave the home , forced out as prostitutes and raped by up to 200 men a day.
attributes.additional_details: The lives of these innocent people are stolen, and if they survive they are damaged for life. The same as murder. I've read cases where the abuser has had lots of women locked up and raped all day long , even children. When he is found guilty he might only get 2 years in jail while these innocent people are destroyed. If this evil becomes a guaranteed life sentence it will decrease the numbers of victims. Any other punishment for such evil is too low. Please see: Hope for Justice, and Love for Justice international.

attributes.action: Allow EAL children to opt out of SATs.
attributes.background: EAL children who have been in school for less than four years should be allowed to opt out of SATs. They and EAL children who have been to more than one school have to take SATs and reach the same standards as English-speaking children who have been to school since nursery or reception.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment, EAL children need to become fluent in 2 years only and catch up on the English curriculum at the same time. 
It is also makes it difficult for schools with a large influx of new arrivals to achieve national standards and therefore these schools struggle to become “good” or “outstanding”. 
The government should allow at least 4 years for these pupils to catch up (time children spend in KS2)!

attributes.action: Require social media to check content on children's videos before publication
attributes.background: Too many videos are being created which are aimed at children which are violent, graphic, disturbing or otherwise unsuitable.
attributes.additional_details:
Make it law that all videos meant for children are pre-screened to prevent these abhorrent creations from being viewed by children E.g. sick cartoons showing graphic content and other disturbing content.

These are being viewed by children! The impacts of this material can be life-changing and needs to stop.

attributes.action: Set the U.K. minimum legal age to 21 for cosmetic breast augmentations.
attributes.background: I was 18 when I had my Breast implant surgery. 18 is still very vulnerable and impressionable. Breast Implant Illness causes distressing and life-changing symptoms, even after explanting not every woman fully recovers.
attributes.additional_details:
"International Consortium of Investigative Journalists found that:
 
More than 1,200 serious incidents linked to breast implants have been reported in the UK since the start of 2015.
 
Links made between popular textured implants and a rare type of cancer.
 
Reports of ruptured implants, pain, disfigurement, allergic reactions and other symptoms."
 
It’s almost 10 years on and I've been suffering with fatigue, hair loss, panic attacks and joint pains ever since.

attributes.action: Remove the Benefit Cap for Single Parents
attributes.background: The benefit cap is discriminating against single parents, leaving mothers/fathers with young children with large shortfalls between rent and top up.

attributes.action: Condemn Pulwama attack by stopping the millions in British aid to Pakistan.
attributes.background: At least 40 Indian paramilitary police have been killed in a bomb attack believed to have been carried out by Pakistan-based Islamist group Jaish-e-Mohammad on their convoy. India has called for international sanctions against Jaish-e-Mohammad's leader, Masood Azhar.
attributes.additional_details:
Pakistan rejected suggestions that it was responsible for it.

Source: BBC

Who are Jaish-e-Mohammad?

Started by cleric Masood Azhar in 2000, the group has been blamed for attacks on India, including one in 2001 on the Parliament in Delhi. It is also said to have introduced suicide bombings in Kashmir, with the first such attack taking place in 2000. It has been designated a "terrorist" organisation by India, the UK, US and UN. However, Masood Azhar remains at large and is reportedly based in the Bahawalpur area in Pakistan's Punjab province.

attributes.action: Commit to giving the whole UK a say in all independence referendums
attributes.background: Just like the EU referendum, an independence referendum affects the interests of everyone in the UK not just the people who want independence. The Government should say that all future independence referendums will allow all the people of the UK a say as they affect us all.

attributes.action: Introduce 'on road' Cycling to Driving lessons/Driving Test
attributes.background: Driving Test/Lessons to include 3 Hours (30 minute segments) of on road cycling for those able to do so
attributes.additional_details: Give humans the perspective to see the road from both a driving a car and riding a bicycle

attributes.action: Partners should be entitled to be Next of Kin during inquests
attributes.background: Rules for coroners should change so unmarried partners who have been nominated as next of kin are recognised as such during inquests.
attributes.additional_details: I lived with my partner for two years and was his next of kin, after death this resumed back to his blood relatives. I was not entitled to his medical notes and rights to attend an inquest.

attributes.action: Fund aspiring commercial pilots training
attributes.background: The costs of pilot training are huge, and can be up to around £130,000. There are no current programmes in the UK that can assist aspiring pilots with the necessary funding for their training. However, those going to university can get assistance, but aspiring pilots can't at the moment.
attributes.additional_details:
BALPA, who represent over 85% of UK pilots, are now forecasting a shortage of pilots in the near future, and the costs of pilot training are one of the main factors putting people off; as they quite simply can't afford it.

https://blog.balpa.org/Blog/February-2018/Pilot-shortage-Fact-or-fiction

https://www.balpa.org/Media-Centre/Press-Releases/Aspiring-pilots-face-double-the-debt-of-university

attributes.action: UK must NOT leave EURATOM. HMG & Parliament have no Legal Basis in Referendum.
attributes.background:
Brexit Referendum  voted: Leave EU. NO hint of Euratom. No HMG publication, no Parliament statement, no ministerial speech said UK could leave Euratom. 1975 Referendum voted REMAIN.
Action required by Government & Parliament:
1. Withdraw Article 50 Letter
2. Hold debate and Referendum on Euratom.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1975 People agreed to REMAIN in the European COMMUNITY (EEC or Common Market & EURATOM= European Atomic Energy Community on nuclear security, energy, medicine).  Later, articles changed EEC treaty into Lisbon Treaty creating European UNION. In 2016 People voted LEAVE the EU only - meaning modifications to EEC are illegal. HMG must keep UK a member of Euratom. A legal referendum on EURATOM is required before UK can leave it.
HMG cannot withdraw from Euratom until after People vote to do so.

attributes.action: Make Homework voluntary for students in Secondary School
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Fund IVF for every same-sex female couple who meets NICE criteria
attributes.background: It’s so expensive for same sex couples to have IVF treatment. I think that it should be as easy for same-sex couples to have a baby on the NHS as it is for heterosexual couples. It’s hard to find the money for IVF treatment even with a full-time job, why can it not be made simpler?

attributes.action: Mechanism for second Brexit Referendum that will resolve the current stalemate
attributes.background:
The 'Leave' Campaign won the first referendum but there was little definition about what 'Leave' meant and now there is no agreement about what to do next.

The Conservatives are split, no-one knows what Labour want and the Liberals are irrelevant.

We have a stalemate and we need a way out.
attributes.additional_details:
We need a new referendum offering the 3 options of Hard Brexit, Theresa May's Deal and Remain. The successful option would need to be supported by all MP's

We need to avoid splitting the Remain or Leave votes across the 'Middle Option'.

Voters would get a 1st and 2nd choice in the vote. If no option wins greater than 50%  of the 1st choice votes then the lowest scoring option would be eliminated and the 2nd choice votes from that option counted. 

All options represented with one clear winner

attributes.action: To stop the import of Butterflies and insects.
attributes.background: I'm starting this petition to stop the import of Butterflies and insects to be used as ornaments.

attributes.action: Require alcohol to be clearly labelled on food products containing it.
attributes.background: Many people boycott alcohol for religious, health beliefs & refuse to come anywhere near it if they are for example recovering alcoholics - whereas just the merest taste of alcohol could lead to fatal consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Make CLEAR LABELLING - ALCOHOL CONTAINED MANDATORY FOR FOOD PRODUCTS.
 
Some religions boycott alcohol 
Alcoholics and other addicts cannot touch alcohol
 
Sometimes alcohol is obscurely written (mince pies / Christmas cakes etc) and not easily detected.
 
Any food product that contains alcohol or was produced with alcohol must have a big label stating alcohol was used in the production of this product.

attributes.action: Reverse VAT Charges now payable by Residents living in Retirement Accommodation.
attributes.background: All Leaseholders living in Retirement Flats in future are liable for the new VAT Charge.  This is being passed on by the Management Agents to Residents for the VAT on their Site Staff Salaries, Employers  N.I.  and Pension Contributions which was introduced in Sept 2018.  With effect from Nov.2018.
attributes.additional_details: It is essential in Retirement properties to have a Site Manager and whose salary etc. is included within the monthly service charge.  This additional increase by the Government will put financial pressure on pensioners.   As the rule stands now we have no option but to pay this unfair charge.  We take pride in being self supporting and feel strongly that we are being penalized by this new ruling.
